subject: Re: FW: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project
body:
[EXTERNAL ?]

Hi Detective,

We worked with Bret and revised the placement of camera F042 on your Deployment Plan https://planner.flocksafety.com/planning-portal/deployment-tracker/public/0f92e14e805f30bf6acf29115ee1c5822b6098ae5c2df90d1c711d20287fcfc85c97710dd98fe864a5dac6f9814a58b68c5803a8fb3289594d80da7ee50a5761  so that it is out of ODOT ROW. Please take a look and let me know if you are ok with this location. It should get the same capture as it did before, we're just a little further north now.

At this moment the location name still reflects the old cross streets. I have asked for this to be updated to reflect the current location. Just an FYI if you notice this when you look.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Regards
	
 
Matt Triana
Project Manager



	
 https://kesq.com/news/2024/06/24/flock-license-plate-reading-cameras-have-led-to-more-than-30-arrests-says-palm-springs-police-department?utm_campaign=EmailSignature&utm_source=PMO&utm_medium=Wisestamp 

	
 	 
 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/GG1LX1QJMN.png> 


On Thu, May 22, 2025 at 7:53?AM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:


	Can you give me a call this morning.  541-682-2682

	
	Derek

	 

	Detective D. DeWitt

	Financial Crimes Unit

	Special Weapons and Tactics Team

	Background Investigations Team

	Eugene Police Department

	300 County Club Road

	Eugene, OR 97401

	Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.

	Desk Phone � 541-682-2682

	Work Cell � 541-743-6192

	 

	From: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com matt.triana@flocksafety.com > 
	Sent: Wednesday, May 21, 2025 2:34 PM
	To: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov >
	Cc: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov >
	Subject: Re: FW: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project

	 

	[EXTERNAL ?]

	Thank you! Looks like the one he is referring to is F042 which we are not moving to install at this time due to it being in ODOT ROW.

	 

	Based on the below email, locations F024 and F025 are actually not in ODOT ROW. Here are the location coordinates for easy reviewing of these locations:

	 

	F024: 44.065012, -123.137917

	F025: 44.084968, -123.154894

	 

	Are these actually COE?

	
 

Matt Triana
Project Manager



	
 https://kesq.com/news/2024/06/24/flock-license-plate-reading-cameras-have-led-to-more-than-30-arrests-says-palm-springs-police-department?utm_campaign=EmailSignature&utm_source=PMO&utm_medium=Wisestamp 

	
 

	 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/GG1LX1QJMN.png> 

	 

	 

	On Wed, May 21, 2025 at 2:26?PM BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov > wrote:

		This was a message from ODOT regarding the locations.  

		 

		 

		Jake Burke

		Captain � Investigations Division

		Eugene Police Department

		300 Country Club Road

		Eugene, Oregon 97401

		(541) 682-5895 work

		 



		From: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov > 
		Sent: Wednesday, May 21, 2025 2:23 PM
		To: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov >
		Cc: ALEXANDER Eric A <Eric.A.ALEXANDER@odot.oregon.gov Eric.A.ALEXANDER@odot.oregon.gov >
		Subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

		 

		[EXTERNAL ?]

		Good afternoon Jake,

		 

		I have not heard from upline management yet. What I did notice after reviewing the 5-license plate reader location plan (attached) the only location on ODOT R/W is Beltline @ W 11th.  

		 

		The other 4 locations on OR99E were jurisdictionally transferred to the City of Eugene in July of 2018 (JT830), meaning no IGA / Permit needed.  

		 

		Any questions let us know thanks -Jim

		 

		Jim Gamble

		District 5 Manager 

		ODOT, Region 2

		2080 Laura Street Springfield OR 97477

		Office: 541-726-2541

		Cell: 541-521-1804

		 

		From: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov > 
		Sent: Monday, May 12, 2025 7:41 AM
		To: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov >
		Subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

		 

	This message was sent from outside the organization. Treat attachments, links and requests with caution. Be conscious of the information you share if you respond. 

		Good morning, James, 

		 

		Checking in to see if Flock reached out to you about install of cameras at any ODOT related intersections in or near the city.  Their install groups are starting to do site surveys in the city and moving quickly.  

		 

		Thanks

		 

		 

		Jake Burke

		Captain � Investigations Division

		Eugene Police Department

		300 Country Club Road

		Eugene, Oregon 97401

		(541) 682-5895 work

		 



		From: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov > 
		Sent: Friday, April 18, 2025 11:54 AM
		To: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov >
		Cc: ALEXANDER Eric A <Eric.A.ALEXANDER@odot.oregon.gov Eric.A.ALEXANDER@odot.oregon.gov >
		Subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

		 

		[EXTERNAL ?]

		Just send it to me for now and we can route it from there, my contact info is listed below. Thanks -Jim

		 

		Jim Gamble

		District 5 Manager 

		ODOT, Region 2

		2080 Laura Street Springfield OR 97477

		Office: 541-726-2541

		 

		From: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov > 
		Sent: Friday, April 18, 2025 8:15 AM
		To: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov >
		Subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

		 

	This message was sent from outside the organization. Treat attachments, links and requests with caution. Be conscious of the information you share if you respond. 

		Good morning, James, 

		 

		We have signed our contract with Flock.  They are requesting a contact with ODOT for locations that may involve ODOT permissions.  Would you be the appropriate contact or can you suggest someone else with your agency?

		 

		Thank you 

		 

		 

		Jake Burke

		Captain � Investigations Division

		Eugene Police Department

		300 Country Club Road

		Eugene, Oregon 97401

		(541) 682-5895 work

		 



		From: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov > 
		Sent: Friday, March 14, 2025 2:02 PM
		To: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov >
		Subject: FW: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

		 

		[EXTERNAL ?]

		Jake this is some good news written below, possibly in 2-4 months (ODOT Time) we will have a process to make this happen. Thanks -Jim

		 

		From: NEAVOLL Darrin L <Darrin.L.NEAVOLL@odot.oregon.gov Darrin.L.NEAVOLL@odot.oregon.gov > 
		Sent: Friday, March 14, 2025 10:31 AM
		To: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov >
		Cc: MCGILL Galen E <Galen.E.MCGILL@odot.oregon.gov Galen.E.MCGILL@odot.oregon.gov >
		Subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

		 

		Jim, thanks for reaching out. As Angela says, we are working on allowing them. We had 3 communities go out and put them on our R/W without permission and we had to have them removed. We are going to work with one of the communities to develop an IGA that would allow these on R/W. Within the IGA we will require anything that is installs a ground mount we will all do a Land Use Permit that will cost them $250 for the first year and $100 every year after. At this time we are saying nothing attached to our features or on interstate. 

		 

		We would like to get one through the process and then finalize our process and then open it up statewide. If you can hold the City of Eugene off a few months until we do that, we would appreciate that. Galen if I missed anything please let me know and Jim if you have follow up questions please let us know.

		 

		Thanks,

		 

		Darrin Neavoll 
		Region 3 Manager
		Office 541-957-3500
		Cell 541-580-7125 

		 

		From: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov > 
		Sent: Friday, March 14, 2025 9:27 AM
		To: NEAVOLL Darrin L <Darrin.L.NEAVOLL@odot.oregon.gov Darrin.L.NEAVOLL@odot.oregon.gov >
		Subject: FW: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

		 

		Good morning Darrin,

		 

		We are working this request for the City of Eugene Police Department to install license plate readers (Automated License plate (ALPR) from Flock Safety) within ODOT R/W and was unsure if it is or has been possible to achieve a yes answer. EPD�s request is listed at the bottom of the thread and City of Eugene�s Traffic Manager is in the loop. 

		 

		The locations I believe are located where cameras/IT already exist, ITS has already stated this not allowed (shown below), and State Traffic suggested reaching out to you. 

		 

		If a TEAMS call easier that works also.  Thanks -Jim

		 

		Jim Gamble

		District 5 Manager 

		ODOT, Region 2

		2080 Laura Street Springfield OR 97477

		Office: 541-726-2541

		Cell: 541-521-1804

		 

		 

		From: KARGEL Angela J <Angela.J.KARGEL@odot.oregon.gov Angela.J.KARGEL@odot.oregon.gov > 
		Sent: Thursday, March 13, 2025 3:48 PM
		To: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov >
		Cc: KIMLINGER Michael J <Michael.J.KIMLINGER@odot.oregon.gov Michael.J.KIMLINGER@odot.oregon.gov >
		Subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

		 

		Hi Jim �Leadership is in the process of putting a new policy in place about license plate readers. (Our current  Passive Electronic Data Collection policy <https://ordot.sharepoint.com/sites/BusinessServices/Shared%20Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?id=%2fsites%2fBusinessServices%2fShared+Documents%2fADM+08+01.pdf&parent=%2fsites%2fBusinessServices%2fShared+Documents&%3d&sdata=cHpFYzJ4cnliR2kxZnV0cmtZNDJCeGkrWUZ2bUtwYVVxdFM4NHhrL3dFVT0%3d>  does not allow for license plate readers on state highway right of way.)  I understand the recent effort involves the requesting law enforcement agency entering into an IGA with ODOT, and ODOT issuing a permit under the IGA criteria.  I haven�t been working on this personally so I don�t know more details.  Mike suggested you contact Galen McGill and R3 Manager Darrin Neavoll about the current work and how the City of Eugene�s request might fit in.  

		-Angela

		 

		 

		From: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov > 
		Sent: Thursday, March 13, 2025 2:16 PM
		To: KARGEL Angela J <Angela.J.KARGEL@odot.oregon.gov Angela.J.KARGEL@odot.oregon.gov >
		Subject: FW: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

		 

		Good afternoon Angela hope you are well,

		 

		We are working this request for the City of Eugene Police Department to install license plate readers (Automated License plate (ALPR) from Flock Safety) within ODOT R/W and was unsure if it is or has been possible to achieve a yes answer. EPD�s request is listed at the bottom of the thread and City of Eugene�s Traffic Manager is in the loop. 

		 

		The locations I believe are located where cameras/IT already exist, ITS has already stated this not allowed (shown below).

		 

		If a TEAMS call easier that works also.  Thanks -Jim

		 

		Jim Gamble

		District 5 Manager 

		ODOT, Region 2

		2080 Laura Street Springfield OR 97477

		Office: 541-726-2541

		Cell: 541-521-1804

		From: SHADDIX Jason P <Jason.P.SHADDIX@odot.oregon.gov Jason.P.SHADDIX@odot.oregon.gov > 
		Sent: Tuesday, March 11, 2025 7:35 AM
		To: MERCADO Renee <Renee.MERCADO@odot.oregon.gov Renee.MERCADO@odot.oregon.gov >; GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov >
		Cc: MESSMAN Joseph * Joe <Joseph.MESSMAN@odot.oregon.gov Joseph.MESSMAN@odot.oregon.gov >
		Subject: Re: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

		 

		We do not allow others to mount to existing infrastructure. I'll have to look into adding to our ROW, which I doubt would be cost effective for them were it to be allowed.

		 

		Jason Shaddix | Systems Operations & ITS Manager

		Maint & Operations Branch

		455 Airport Rd. SE, Bldg K, Salem OR 97301

		Jason.p.shaddix@odot.oregon.gov Jason.p.shaddix@odot.oregon.gov  | Transportation Systems Operations - Home (sharepoint.com) <https://ordot.sharepoint.com/sites/ITS?OR=Teams-HL&CT=1630447122947&%3d&sdata=SFlHTmFzV2N6ZVlXbXV3MDltY05XYkxNNnpuekM2bjVHaG5WUEdiMDdIQT0%3d>  | TSSU Web Page https://www.oregon.gov/odot/Maintenance/Pages/Traffic-Systems-Services-Unit.aspx 

		 

________________________________

		From: MERCADO Renee <Renee.MERCADO@odot.oregon.gov Renee.MERCADO@odot.oregon.gov >
		Sent: Monday, March 10, 2025 10:17 AM
		To: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov >
		Cc: SHADDIX Jason P <Jason.P.SHADDIX@odot.oregon.gov Jason.P.SHADDIX@odot.oregon.gov >; MESSMAN Joseph * Joe <Joseph.MESSMAN@odot.oregon.gov Joseph.MESSMAN@odot.oregon.gov >
		Subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

		 

		Jason is out sick today.  We will review this later in the week when he returns and get back to you.

		 

		From: MESSMAN Joseph * Joe <Joseph.MESSMAN@odot.oregon.gov Joseph.MESSMAN@odot.oregon.gov > 
		Sent: Monday, March 10, 2025 8:08 AM
		To: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov >
		Cc: SHADDIX Jason P <Jason.P.SHADDIX@odot.oregon.gov Jason.P.SHADDIX@odot.oregon.gov >; MERCADO Renee <Renee.MERCADO@odot.oregon.gov Renee.MERCADO@odot.oregon.gov >
		Subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 
		Importance: High

		 

		Hi Jim,

		 

		This particular request would be handled by ITS and I have copied Jason Shaddix and Renee Mercado as these questions will need to be answered by them.

		 

		Respectfully,

		 

		Joe Messman | ODOT Maintenance & Operations Branch | Wireless Communications Section | Wireless Section Manager 

		455 Airport Road SE, Bldg C | Salem, OR 97301 | Office: 503-507-8485 | Mobile: 503-931-9269 | *: joseph.messman@odot.oregon.gov joseph.messman@odot.oregon.gov 

		 

		From: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov > 
		Sent: Friday, March 7, 2025 1:40 PM
		To: MESSMAN Joseph * Joe <Joseph.MESSMAN@odot.oregon.gov Joseph.MESSMAN@odot.oregon.gov >
		Subject: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

		 

		Afternoon Joe,

		 

		Not sure who to work this through but wanted to get your impute to whether this is possible to get to a yes answer. The locations I believe are located where cameras/IT already exist. Thanks -Jim

		 

		Jim Gamble

		District 5 Manager 

		ODOT, Region 2

		2080 Laura Street Springfield OR 97477

		Office: 541-726-2541

		Cell: 541-521-1804

		 

		From: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov > 
		Sent: Friday, March 7, 2025 1:30 PM
		To: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov >
		Subject: ALPR mapping project 

		 

	You don't often get email from jburke@eugene-or.gov jburke@eugene-or.gov . Learn why this is important <https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>  

	

		 

	This message was sent from outside the organization. Treat attachments, links and requests with caution. Be conscious of the information you share if you respond. 

		James, 

		 

		Thank you for the call back.  As I said on the phone we are working on procuring Automated License plate (ALPR) from Flock Safety.  Of the 58 locations we would be getting cameras in the City of Eugene, it was discovered some may be property of ODOT or maintained by ODOT. 

		 

		 Here was the list 

		 

		 

		Private Property Permission needed for:

		*	F#024 SR 99 @ Roosevelt Blvd NB - SR 99 is ODOT ROW 
		*	F#025 SR 99 @ Barger Dr NB - SR 99 is ODOT ROW
		*	F#038 Franklin Bl @ Walnut St WB - Franklin (SR99) ODOT 

		Alternate Locations needed: ODOT ROW is too wide so private property not an option

		*	F039 - SR 99 @ Jessen Dr SB
		*	F#042 Randy Pape Beltline @ W 11th Ave NB

		Other locations to confirm: 

		*	F#019 Club Rd @ I105 SB
		*	F#031 Club Rd @ I105 NB
		*	F#044 River Rd @ Willow Springs Dr SB
		*	F#045 Green Acres Rd @ N Delta Hwy EB

		*	F#056 N Delta Hwy @ Randy Pape Beltline NB

		 

		After speaking with my traffic engineering I believe I have identified which are COE owned and which are ODOT owned.  If I am incorrect please let me know . 

		 

		*	Locations not highlighted are COE owned properties 
		*	Highlighted in Blue are ODOT owned properties managed by COE 
		*	Highlighted in Red are COE owned properties managed by ODOT
		*	Highlighted in Yellow are ODOT owned and maintained 

		 

		What I am asking is for permissions to have ALPR cameras (installed by Flock) placed either on existing infrastructure or right-away at the locations controlled or owned by ODOT.  If yes, what would ODOT require from EPD and/or Flock.  

		 

		Thank you and have a great weekend! 

		 

		 

		 

		 

		 

		Jake Burke

		Captain � Investigations Division

		Eugene Police Department

		300 Country Club Road

		Eugene, Oregon 97401

		(541) 682-5895 work

thread_messages.body:
[EXTERNAL ?]

Hi Detective,

We worked with Bret and revised the placement of camera F042 on your Deployment Plan https://planner.flocksafety.com/planning-portal/deployment-tracker/public/0f92e14e805f30bf6acf29115ee1c5822b6098ae5c2df90d1c711d20287fcfc85c97710dd98fe864a5dac6f9814a58b68c5803a8fb3289594d80da7ee50a5761  so that it is out of ODOT ROW. Please take a look and let me know if you are ok with this location. It should get the same capture as it did before, we're just a little further north now.

At this moment the location name still reflects the old cross streets. I have asked for this to be updated to reflect the current location. Just an FYI if you notice this when you look.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Regards
	
 
Matt Triana
Project Manager

thread_messages.subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project
thread_messages.body:
Jim, thanks for reaching out. As Angela says, we are working on allowing them. We had 3 communities go out and put them on our R/W without permission and we had to have them removed. We are going to work with one of the communities to develop an IGA that would allow these on R/W. Within the IGA we will require anything that is installs a ground mount we will all do a Land Use Permit that will cost them $250 for the first year and $100 every year after. At this time we are saying nothing attached to our features or on interstate. 

		 

		We would like to get one through the process and then finalize our process and then open it up statewide. If you can hold the City of Eugene off a few months until we do that, we would appreciate that. Galen if I missed anything please let me know and Jim if you have follow up questions please let us know.

		 

		Thanks,

		 

		Darrin Neavoll 
		Region 3 Manager
		Office 541-957-3500
		Cell 541-580-7125

thread_messages.subject: FW: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project
thread_messages.body:
Good morning Darrin,

		 

		We are working this request for the City of Eugene Police Department to install license plate readers (Automated License plate (ALPR) from Flock Safety) within ODOT R/W and was unsure if it is or has been possible to achieve a yes answer. EPD�s request is listed at the bottom of the thread and City of Eugene�s Traffic Manager is in the loop. 

		 

		The locations I believe are located where cameras/IT already exist, ITS has already stated this not allowed (shown below), and State Traffic suggested reaching out to you. 

		 

		If a TEAMS call easier that works also.  Thanks -Jim

		 

		Jim Gamble

		District 5 Manager 

		ODOT, Region 2

		2080 Laura Street Springfield OR 97477

		Office: 541-726-2541

		Cell: 541-521-1804

thread_messages.subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project
thread_messages.body:
Hi Jim �Leadership is in the process of putting a new policy in place about license plate readers. (Our current  Passive Electronic Data Collection policy <https://ordot.sharepoint.com/sites/BusinessServices/Shared%20Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?id=%2fsites%2fBusinessServices%2fShared+Documents%2fADM+08+01.pdf&parent=%2fsites%2fBusinessServices%2fShared+Documents&%3d&sdata=cHpFYzJ4cnliR2kxZnV0cmtZNDJCeGkrWUZ2bUtwYVVxdFM4NHhrL3dFVT0%3d>  does not allow for license plate readers on state highway right of way.)  I understand the recent effort involves the requesting law enforcement agency entering into an IGA with ODOT, and ODOT issuing a permit under the IGA criteria.  I haven�t been working on this personally so I don�t know more details.  Mike suggested you contact Galen McGill and R3 Manager Darrin Neavoll about the current work and how the City of Eugene�s request might fit in.  

		-Angela

thread_messages.subject: FW: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project
thread_messages.body:
Good afternoon Angela hope you are well,

		 

		We are working this request for the City of Eugene Police Department to install license plate readers (Automated License plate (ALPR) from Flock Safety) within ODOT R/W and was unsure if it is or has been possible to achieve a yes answer. EPD�s request is listed at the bottom of the thread and City of Eugene�s Traffic Manager is in the loop. 

		 

		The locations I believe are located where cameras/IT already exist, ITS has already stated this not allowed (shown below).

		 

		If a TEAMS call easier that works also.  Thanks -Jim

		 

		Jim Gamble

		District 5 Manager 

		ODOT, Region 2

		2080 Laura Street Springfield OR 97477

		Office: 541-726-2541

		Cell: 541-521-1804

thread_messages.to: MERCADO Renee <Renee.MERCADO@odot.oregon.gov Renee.MERCADO@odot.oregon.gov >; GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov >
thread_messages.subject: Re: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project
thread_messages.body:
We do not allow others to mount to existing infrastructure. I'll have to look into adding to our ROW, which I doubt would be cost effective for them were it to be allowed.

		 

		Jason Shaddix | Systems Operations & ITS Manager

		Maint & Operations Branch

		455 Airport Rd. SE, Bldg K, Salem OR 97301

		Jason.p.shaddix@odot.oregon.gov Jason.p.shaddix@odot.oregon.gov  | Transportation Systems Operations - Home (sharepoint.com) <https://ordot.sharepoint.com/sites/ITS?OR=Teams-HL&CT=1630447122947&%3d&sdata=SFlHTmFzV2N6ZVlXbXV3MDltY05XYkxNNnpuekM2bjVHaG5WUEdiMDdIQT0%3d>  | TSSU Web Page https://www.oregon.gov/odot/Maintenance/Pages/Traffic-Systems-Services-Unit.aspx 

		 

________________________________

thread_messages.subject: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project
thread_messages.body:
Afternoon Joe,

		 

		Not sure who to work this through but wanted to get your impute to whether this is possible to get to a yes answer. The locations I believe are located where cameras/IT already exist. Thanks -Jim

		 

		Jim Gamble

thread_messages.subject: ALPR mapping project
thread_messages.body:
You don't often get email from jburke@eugene-or.gov jburke@eugene-or.gov . Learn why this is important <https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>  

	

		 

	This message was sent from outside the organization. Treat attachments, links and requests with caution. Be conscious of the information you share if you respond. 

		James, 

		 

		Thank you for the call back.  As I said on the phone we are working on procuring Automated License plate (ALPR) from Flock Safety.  Of the 58 locations we would be getting cameras in the City of Eugene, it was discovered some may be property of ODOT or maintained by ODOT. 

		 

		 Here was the list 

		 

		 

		Private Property Permission needed for:

		*	F#024 SR 99 @ Roosevelt Blvd NB - SR 99 is ODOT ROW 
		*	F#025 SR 99 @ Barger Dr NB - SR 99 is ODOT ROW
		*	F#038 Franklin Bl @ Walnut St WB - Franklin (SR99) ODOT 

		Alternate Locations needed: ODOT ROW is too wide so private property not an option

		*	F039 - SR 99 @ Jessen Dr SB
		*	F#042 Randy Pape Beltline @ W 11th Ave NB

		Other locations to confirm: 

		*	F#019 Club Rd @ I105 SB
		*	F#031 Club Rd @ I105 NB
		*	F#044 River Rd @ Willow Springs Dr SB
		*	F#045 Green Acres Rd @ N Delta Hwy EB

		*	F#056 N Delta Hwy @ Randy Pape Beltline NB

		 

		After speaking with my traffic engineering I believe I have identified which are COE owned and which are ODOT owned.  If I am incorrect please let me know . 

		 

		*	Locations not highlighted are COE owned properties 
		*	Highlighted in Blue are ODOT owned properties managed by COE 
		*	Highlighted in Red are COE owned properties managed by ODOT
		*	Highlighted in Yellow are ODOT owned and maintained 

		 

		What I am asking is for permissions to have ALPR cameras (installed by Flock) placed either on existing infrastructure or right-away at the locations controlled or owned by ODOT.  If yes, what would ODOT require from EPD and/or Flock.  

		 

		Thank you and have a great weekend! 

		 

		 

		 

		 

		 

		Jake Burke

		Captain � Investigations Division

		Eugene Police Department

		300 Country Club Road

		Eugene, Oregon 97401

		(541) 682-5895 work
